sentences.sContent: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.sCn: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.sContent: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.sCn: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.sContent: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.sCn: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.sContent: ...Leah gave up what she had and set up her own yoga studios...
...1 felt powerful because 1 broke through my own limitations...
...These teams are gaining more power to run their own affairs...
...the tragedy is that he didn't follow his own advice...
...I did some of my own polling among students and professors...
...we should be delighted to pursue knowledge for its own sake--even when what we find out is something we didn't particularly want to 36...
...combined with their own personal characteristics—how healthy they feel they are...
...I want to continue my studies for their own sake because I love what I am doing...
...what made you want to run your own store...

phrases.pCn: 凭自己的力量，他们自己；静静独处
他自己的；属于他自己的
自有品牌；使用自己商标的商品
靠自己；独自一人；一己之力
adv. 独立地；独自地；主动地
接受、承认个人的真实情感
影响本身利益的错误行为；[足球]误中本队球门

trans.tranOther: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours
